question.title: How to Extract Data from Java Drag-and-Drop into PySide2 Application
question.body:
I have a Java GUI application with a treeView widget, where drag-and-drop is already enabled. I drag an item from the treeView and try to drop it into another application built using Python and PySide2. This second application has a QTableWidget with the Drop property set to True.

However, when I drag and drop the item, I don't get the exact text that I expect. Instead, I receive the following data:

java dataflavor: application/x-java-serialized-object class=com.customPackage.Treeset.CompObjSet

How can I extract the actual data from this? Is there any way to check if the dropped data contains useful information or if it's in a serializable object format? Any insights on how to handle this ?

question_comments.body: I tried javaobj-py3 but didn't get succeed. You are right , This is proprietary software so no option.

If you're lucky, it might be possible to deserialise the object with e.g. javaobj-py3. Or if that doesn't work, it may be serialised as json, so you could try e.g. json.loads( bytes(mimedata.data()).decode()). However, if you're unlucky, the object may be serialised using a custom binary format that's only readable by the originating java application. For proprietary software, there would probably be nothing more you can do; but for open-source, it should be possible to reverse-engineer the format.

The fact that the mime is named "x-java-serialized-object" should be a clear hint. Qt item views normally accept drops only in its own serialized data built from other item views, and it's unclear how you're actually getting the above information (maybe you overrode dropEvent()?), but higher classes such as QTableWidget should normally override dropMimeData(). You need to search how the mime data is created in java, so that you can eventually unserialize it from PySide.
It is unclear how the Java application and how the Python application works and how they interact. Add a minimal reproducible example so others can understand and reproduce the issue.
